body: The S3 backend is implemented on top of the [official aws sdk](https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go) which is where all the XML parsing happens so for the deserialization error we'd problem need to open an issue there. However what is bothering me is how the control character made it into the name in the first place. All names encrypted by the crypt backend should be in base32 so I can't see how such an object could have been created through it.

So it's a core bug? Is there any plans on fixing it??
I requested addition information from the Scaleway's back-end logs, here is the reply:

> Hello,
> Here are the logs with the rclone that uploaded the said file :
> 
> `|Time|Method|Bytes received|URI|Return code| |-|-|-|-|-| |Jul 9 11:33:53|PUT|50|/data/%2501-position-left-01%3FX-Amz-Algorithm%3DAWS4-HMAC-SHA256%26X-Amz-Credential%3DSCW0CSQ8B0VMC5DS4B66%252F20190709%252Fnl-ams%252Fs3%252Faws4_request%26X-Amz-Date%3D20190709T113353Z%26X-Amz-Expires%3D900%26X-Amz-SignedHeaders%3Dcontent-type%253Bhost%253Bx-amz-acl%253Bx-amz-meta-mtime%26X-Amz-Signature%3Df8ccb969dd8b7acd192da680f03a033930410b89030f837d7309a3dfe6b6ec19|200|`
> 
> 
> At first there is a crash, and the it gives the list again.
> --
> Regards / Cordialement
> Julien S.
> Customer Success Specialist - Advanced Support
> Scaleway (Scaleway / Online by Scaleway / Scaleway Datacenter)

> So it's a core bug? Is there any plans on fixing it??

Definitely! The request doesn't look right to me however I'm not that familiar with the s3 backend and don't have access to Scaleway. I'll see if I can reproduce this with another S3 implementation but we may need to wait for ncw to return from vacation to fix this.

I'm stupid for not thinking about this earlier but it appears that you ran the rclone info command on your s3 backend. This command is specifically for testing which characters a backend supports including and the file `-position-left-05` is definetly created by this command. While unfortunate it is somewhat expected for this command to break certain backends so this isn't really a bug. However the XML encoding decoding bug in the AWS library still stands.

which command do you mean? During all times I only used mount, copy, sync, check, cryptcheck,and ls*. Mostly on crypt remote which wraps the s3. 
Anyway this idea of creating test file on remote that might crash the server is not good )

The command is `rclone info` for this very reason it is not even listed in the help but the file pretty much guaranteed to be the result of this command.
https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/0a1169e659ec596172ac7d67acb1c9b8fc2bb385/cmd/info/info.go#L157
I have never run this on remote
Are you sure about that? The relevant code is not called from anywhere else.

I cant recall that.
I dont even see this command in bash history :S .. it could be done theoretically, but cant see this happening in history. Might be other reason?

I really can't think of anything else. For now it would be best if you'd just remove the problematic files via the web interface. I don't see anything in the code that should cause them to be created again so your setup should be fine. I'll leave this issue open because of the upstream XML decoding issue. Of course if you have any new information or should this issue arise again you should update this issue. For now this is all I can think of.

rename.from: Bug with filenames on Amazon / S3-Comp. remotes. All failing. Crypt related?
rename.to: upstream XML decoding bug.. command rclone info has broken s3 remote

body:
ok. I leave this issue to it. This command could be called. The web interface crashes too btw))
Probably there should be a warning or simple confirmation window appear prior execution of such a deadly script with popular name "info"?

I started to get such timeout/socket errors in rclone logs that are not even formatted corretly: Example: ``` 2019/07/16 10:02:15 ERROR : appdata_oct3sz744045/preview/222261/256-144.jpg: Failed to copy: s3 upload: 400 Bad Request: RequestTimeoutYour socket connection to the server was not read from or written to within the timeout period.tx14822e543e904b6d94eeb-005d2d8464 2019/07/16 10:02:15 ERROR : appdata_oct3sz744045/preview/222261/256-144.jpg(0xc02c8603c0): failed to transfer file from cache to remote: s3 upload: 400 Bad Request: RequestTimeoutYour socket connection to the server was not read from or written to within the timeout period.tx14822e543e904b6d94eeb-005d2d8464 2019/07/16 10:02:15 ERROR : appdata_oct3sz744045/preview/222261/256-144.jpg(0xc02c8603c0): RWFileHandle.Flush error: failed to transfer file from cache to remote: s3 upload: 400 Bad Request: RequestTimeoutYour socket connection to the server was not read from or written to within the timeout period.tx14822e543e904b6d94eeb-005d2d8464 ``` Using the same setup as described above. Any thoughts ?

I found an issue about this here: https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/issues/1914

It looks like there may be a work-around

> As a workaround I'm retrieving url-encoded keys with s3.ListObjectsV2Input.EncodingType attribute set to aws.String(s3.EncodingTypeUrl), but it will still be nice to have this properly resolved on the service end.

This would be quite easy to try if someone wants to have a go?

I had a go at a fix here:

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.48.0-074-g7afad074-fix-3345-s3-encoding-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

This needs to be run through the integration tests for all the other s3 backends so may need to be optional for AWS only - not sure!
I'm going to merge this as part of #3148

We were having a similar issue using rclone and getting serialization errors with XML when trying to list or purge the contents of a bucket. So I downloaded the beta, but, we still get the same errors.

`2019/09/13 16:33:33 Failed to ls: SerializationError: failed to decode REST XML response`
        `status code: 200, request id: e2e74c4c-28e0-43c1-bf5f-dcbdcee6cde3`
`caused by: XML syntax error on line 1: illegal character code U+0003`

Upon further investigation I think the culprit is file names that have % symbols in them, and this is breaking the XML parser. For example:
`test 60% dark.pdf.enc`

Should this fix also work for that?

> We were having a similar issue using rclone and getting serialization errors with XML when trying to list or purge the contents of a bucket. So I downloaded the beta, but, we still get the same errors.
> 
> `2019/09/13 16:33:33 Failed to ls: SerializationError: failed to decode REST XML response`
> `status code: 200, request id: e2e74c4c-28e0-43c1-bf5f-dcbdcee6cde3`
> `caused by: XML syntax error on line 1: illegal character code U+0003`

The error message indicated that the character it is having trouble with is 0x03 so a control character...

Could you try this beta - this is the proper fix and I think it should work...

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.49.0-031-ge5c6c14b-filename-encode-beta/

I've tried the recommended beta and it still does not work:
```[root@rclone ~]# rclone version
rclone v1.49.0-031-ge5c6c14b-filename-encode-beta
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.12.9
[root@rclone ~]# rclone -vvvv purge COS:lsntervals-documents-2/10215/0/
2019/09/16 14:24:59 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.49.0-031-ge5c6c14b-filename-encode-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vvvv" "ls" "COS:cos-intervals-documents-2/10215/0/"]
2019/09/16 14:24:59 DEBUG : Using config file from "/root/.rclone.conf"
2019/09/16 14:25:00 Failed to ls: SerializationError: failed to decode REST XML response
        status code: 200, request id: 76dac097-bf12-45b4-941f-59597961c84b
caused by: XML syntax error on line 1: illegal character code U+0003
```
